title: change background to purple
description:
## Implementation Plan: Change App Background to Purple

### Overview
Change the main application background color from white/dark gray to purple (`#6b21a8`) in both light and dark modes, ensuring proper text contrast and visual hierarchy.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Main background (`--color-bg`) is purple `#6b21a8` in light mode
- [ ] Main background (`--color-bg`) is a darker purple in dark mode for differentiation
- [ ] Text remains readable (WCAG AA contrast ratio 4.5:1 minimum)
- [ ] Secondary background (`--color-bg-secondary`) harmonizes with purple theme
- [ ] Input fields and cards remain visually distinct
- [ ] Sidebar active state visible against purple background
- [ ] No linter errors
- [ ] App renders correctly in both light and dark modes

### Implementation Steps
1. Update `:root` CSS variables in `app.css`:
   - Change `--color-bg: #ffffff` to `--color-bg: #6b21a8`
   - Update `--color-bg-secondary` to a complementary purple (e.g., `#7c3aed` lighter or `#581c87` darker)
   - Update `--color-text` to light color (`#f3f4f6` or `#ffffff`) for contrast
   - Update `--color-text-secondary` to a lighter muted color
   - Update `--color-border` to visible purple shade
   - Update `--color-sidebar-active` to work on purple

2. Update dark mode CSS variables in `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)`:
   - Change `--color-bg` to darker purple (e.g., `#4c1d95` or `#3b0764`)
   - Adjust secondary background accordingly
   - Ensure text colors maintain contrast

3. Update theme-color meta tag in `+layout.svelte` to match new purple theme

### Files to Modify
- `frontend/src/app.css` - Lines 1-42 (CSS variable definitions for both modes)
- `frontend/src/routes/+layout.svelte` - Line 236 (theme-color meta tag)

### Testing
- Open app in browser, verify purple background displays
- Toggle system dark mode, verify darker purple appears
- Check text readability across all pages
- Verify input fields, cards, buttons are visually distinct
- Test sidebar highlighting is visible

### Edge Cases
- Cards use `--color-bg` - may need to stand out from main background (consider using secondary color)
- Input fields use `--color-bg` - ensure they're distinguishable from page background
- Some components may have hardcoded colors - search for any direct color values

### Color Palette Reference
Suggested palette based on `#6b21a8`:
- Light mode bg: `#6b21a8` (user specified)
- Dark mode bg: `#4c1d95` (darker purple)
- Secondary: `#7c3aed` (lighter purple) or `#581c87` (deeper purple)
- Text: `#f9fafb` (near white)
- Text secondary: `#d4d4d8` (light gray)
- Border: `#9333ea` (bright purple for visibility)

## Clarification Needed

Before I can create an implementation plan, I need to understand a few things:

### 1. Which background should change?
The app has multiple backgrounds:
- **Main app background** (`--color-bg`) - affects entire app body
- **Secondary background** (`--color-bg-secondary`) - used for cards, code blocks, hover states
- **Sidebar active state** (`--color-sidebar-active`) - highlight for active sidebar items

Are you referring to the main app background?

### 2. What shade of purple?
Please specify one of:
- A specific hex code (e.g., `#6b21a8`)
- A general tone (e.g., light lavender, deep violet, muted purple)
- A reference (e.g., "like Bluesky's purple")

### 3. Should this affect both light and dark modes?
Currently the app has:
- Light mode: white background (`#ffffff`)
- Dark mode: dark gray background (`#1a1a1a`)

Options:
- **A)** Purple in both modes (different shades for each)
- **B)** Purple in light mode only, dark purple/gray in dark mode
- **C)** Replace dark mode with purple theme

### 4. Is this a permanent change or a theme option?
- **A)** Permanent change - purple becomes the default
- **B)** New theme option - user can choose purple

Please respond in a comment and I'll generate the implementation plan.
